channel.title: Better Alternative to Uploading?
channel.description:
I probably already know the answer to this question, but.
Does anyone know a better alternative to uploading? My upload speed is absolute trash, and I don't want to wait an hour and thirty minutes for an upload to complete. Dropbox/any file sharing utensil in that manner is the same thing, so if you've got that in mind - don't say it.
Edit: A simple 'no' will suffice enough for me. Though, if you know one, please tell me!

item.title: Better Alternative to Uploading?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Manually transfer your files. Try using a local network or portable storage devices.
If you’re uploading files online for everybody to access on the internet, your only option is to get better speed or “borrow” somebody else’s.

Read full topic

item.title: Better Alternative to Uploading?
item.dc:creator: @SmdScape SmdScape
item.description:
@SmdScape wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:8, topic:540006”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=658856.msg4406846#msg4406846 date=1392255155]
It’s been over 1 hour and 30 minutes by now. The upload should be finished.
[/quote]I’ve been. Regardless, if there was an alternative, I’d very much like to know for future reference.

[quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658856.msg4406833#msg4406833 date=1392252830]

[quote author=Uncalled link=topic=658856.msg4406811#msg4406811 date=1392245933]

[quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=658856.msg4406807#msg4406807 date=1392245632]
What exactly are you uploading?
[/quote]A zip file.
[/quote]So you want to upload without uploading? Lol. There is no other option but to upgrade your upload speed.
[/quote]Lol, yeah that’s why I said I probably already know the answer. I was just wondering if there was some way to like immediately transfer a file from host to host.[/quote]

Oh sure, the bandwidth fairies will transfer anything you need ASAP.

In all seriousness though, if you live in a somewhat crowded part of a city, you can go ahead and buy a wifi pci card and pray that your neighbors are dumb enough to not have locked their wifi, but if there are no wifi signals, just return the product.

Can’t lose. Fool proof plan. Much success. So wifi. Many upload.

And no, there is no immediate file-to-file transfer.
Everything on the internet is download/upload speed-dependent.

Read full topic

item.title: Better Alternative to Uploading?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

There isn’t anyway around your upload speed… No matter the method (P2P, cloud uploading, etc.). You’re still uploading…

Read full topic
